title: Too Hot for Radio Rabih Alameddine: "The Prom Terrorists"
description:
An FBI probe into potential terrorists at a prom is the perfect setup for this high-paced satire that covers youth, sex, politics, religion, education, and the government. Written by the award-winning author of Wrong End of the Telescope, and read by Raffi Barsoumian (DC's Legends of Tomorrow and The Vampire Diaries).  It was one of the pieces commissioned by Selected Shorts for its new anthology, Small Odysseys.

Join and give!: https://donatenow.networkforgood.org/symphonyspacenyc?code=Splashpage
author: mary.shimkin@symphonyspace.org (Symphony Space)
